Postman is the world’s leading API platform, used by more than 25 million developers and 500,000 organizations, including 98% of the Fortune 500. Postman is helping developers and professionals across the globe build the API-first world by simplifying each step of the API lifecycle and streamlining collaboration—enabling users to create better APIs, faster.

The company is headquartered in San Francisco and has an office in Bangalore, where it was founded. Postman is privately held, with funding from Battery Ventures, BOND, Coatue, CRV, Insight Partners, and Nexus Venture Partners. Learn more at postman.com or connect with Postman on Twitter via @getpostman.

P.S: We highly recommend reading The "API-First World" graphic novel to understand the bigger picture and our vision at Postman.

The Opportunity:

We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making and deliver actionable insights that will contribute to accelerating and scaling the next stage of user and ARR growth for Postman. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze data, identify trends, and provide recommendations for product improvements. Your work will directly impact our product roadmap and overall user experience.

The position will be a key partner to help drive decision making in conjunction with cross functional teams, using the broad base of customer data available in our data warehouse(s). The person in this role will be expected to generate insights from the data on a proactive basis, while also being able to design and analyze experiments meant to better understand the motivations of a diverse customer base.

Ultimately, a successful person in this role will be expected to be a resident expert in their area of the business, and can work autonomously leading analytics efforts to encourage the team to improve the customer experience and metrics.

What You’ll Do:
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights related to user behavior, product usage, and market trends.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and communicate findings to stakeholders.
A/B Testing: Plan and conduct A/B tests to assess the impact of product changes, and provide recommendations based on the results.
Product Strategy: Collaborate with product managers to align data analysis with product development, helping to define and prioritize features and improvements.
Data Quality: Ensure data accuracy and consistency, and work with relevant teams to resolve data quality issues.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, design, marketing, and other teams to drive product improvements and optimize user experiences.
Forecasting: Develop forecasting models to estimate future product performance and identify potential opportunities and challenges.
Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts and contribute to building a strong data-driven culture within the organization.
About You:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics).
4-6 years experience as a Product Analyst or similar role, with a focus on data analysis and product insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with web and mobile analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Amplitude) is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
A passion for product development and a customer-focused mindset.
Knowledge of machine learning and predictive modeling is a bonus.
Prior knowledge of developer tools, with emphasis on API development (preferred).
Our Values:

At Postman, we create with the same curiosity that we see in our users. We value transparency & honest communication about not only successes, but also failures. In our work, we focus on specific goals that add up to a larger vision. Our inclusive work culture ensures that everyone is valued equally as important pieces of our final product. We are dedicated to delivering the best products we can.

What Else?

This role is based in the greater San Francisco Bay area, and the reasonably estimated salary for this role ranges from $155,635 to 190,220, plus a competitive equity package. Actual compensation is based on the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition to our pay-on-performance philosophy, we offer a comprehensive set of benefits, including full medical coverage, flexible PTO, wellness reimbursement, and a monthly lunch stipend. Salaries will vary outside of the listed metropolitan areas & the U.S.

Equal Opportunity

The Research Data Analyst involves gathering, analyzing, and interpreting a wide variety of research data. Designs and conducts research including selecting data samples, developing research instruments, analyzing collected information according to established statistical methods, and developing recommendations based on research findings. Prepares reports, charts, tables, and other visual aids to interpret and communicate data and results.

The Research Data Analyst will be responsible for managing and analyzing data from studies addressing how well the health care system works when it does not perform optimally, and what factors determine whether care is high quality, efficient, and focused on the needs of the patient. Because the information available about health care is evolving, we also are using big data and machine learning techniques to understand the benefits of and failures of, the health system. The goal of our research is to identify policies and practices that clinical organizations, payers, and the government could adopt that would make healthcare outcomes better and healthcare costs lower for individual patients and society as a whole.

The Research Data Analyst's responsibilities will include managing, designing, and improving datasets; extracting and cleaning datasets; designing, conducting, and interpreting basic and advanced statistical analysis; preparation of summary reports, charts, tables, and figures; and contributions to publications and presentations of this data. In addition, the job will include performance (with guidance from the lead investigators and from statisticians) of complicated statistical analysis—including mixed modeling, linear regression, latent class analysis, ROC analysis, model calibration, and unbiased hierarchical clustering in addition to more common statistics such as Fisher’s exact test, Students T-test, and Kaplan Meier plots—and of machine learning. The individual will present the data to the Principal Investigator (PI) and make additional analyses or adjustments after review of the results. The Research Analyst will generate tabulated tables summarizing the results so that they are suitable for publication.

About UCSF

The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.

Pride Values

UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu

Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.

Job Title: Research Data Analyst - Addiction Care Team
Job Description:
Involves gathering, analyzing, and interpreting a wide variety of Addiction Care Team research data. Duties may include but will not be limited to supporting the oversight and coordinating the tasks of single or multiple clinical research studies, (e.g., Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital) depending on their size and complexity. The research data analyst (RDA) will help to conduct qualitative interviews; create the codebook; training research staff to conduct qualitative research; and assist with data analysis, including preparing reports, charts, tables, and other visual aids to interpret and communicate data and results. They may oversee socio-demographic data and interview process; track and report on study results; create, and update databases; assist the PI with oversight of other research staff; participate in the review and writing of protocols to ensure Institutional Review Board approval within University compliance; help assure compliance with all relevant regulatory agencies; oversee study data integrity; implement and maintain periodic quality control procedures; interface with departments to obtain UCSF approval prior to study initiation; maintain all regulatory documents; report study progress to investigators; and participate in any internal and external audits or reviews of study protocols.

UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu

Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.

Academia.edu is a venture-backed, for-profit business based in San Francisco. Our mission is to accelerate the world's research, and we have spent the last 13 years building the largest online network for sharing and finding academic research and connecting with other academics around the world. With over 236 million users, nearly half of the world's academics using our platform every month, and hundreds of thousands of paying subscribers, we are well positioned to achieve our mission.



About the data team:
The data team includes folks from various backgrounds including academia, consulting, government, and tech. Product data analysts are embedded on various product teams, some of which currently include author products, publishing, user segmentation, mobile apps, and SEO. We rotate product team assignments every 6-12 months, creating opportunities to work on various products at different maturity stages. The team shares what they're working on a few times a week to enhance transparency and create space for within-team collaboration. Identifying opportunities for learning on your own and with others is highly encouraged. Our stack includes Redshift for our data warehouse; Sisense/Periscope for dashboarding; DBT for data transformations; and SQL plus Python or R for analyses.

Please note that this role is in the San Francisco Bay Area. We're excited to have a packed and lively office on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Twice a week, those of us in the Bay Area come to our office located in the Financial District for All Hands, intense collaboration, brainstorming activities, and fun events. There are small rooms for 1-1 mentoring sessions or heads down work, and larger rooms for team activities. We continue to support a flexible work environment for all of life’s surprises and needs with generous time off and flexible work schedules.

Diversity and Inclusion:
Academia is a proud equal-opportunity employer and we are committed to hiring and supporting a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
How You'll Contribute
Partner with product managers, software developers, and executives to identify underlying questions, uncover insights, and generate product recommendations.
Own A/B testing data and analyses for your embedded product team. Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Automate recurring questions using different elements of our data stack.
About You
The following is an ideal list of skills for this position. Please feel free to apply even if you don't meet all of the requirements below
3+ years of relevant experience doing product analytics and/or data analytics.
Excellent SQL skills. This includes working with tables up to a few TB large, using CTEs, and using window functions.
Industry experience with descriptive statistics and A/B testing approaches.
Experience with Python or R for data analysis.
Open to learning new languages and tools as needed.
Experience with various parts of our stack mentioned in the “About the data team” section is a plus.
Benefits & Perks
Competitive salary, stock options, Flexible Spending Account (FSA) & Dependent Care Account (DCA), & a 401(k).
Fully covered medical, dental, & vision insurance for employees & their dependents.
Flexible sick days, flexible hours, 21 days of paid vacation, 12 paid company holidays, and paid parental leave.
New Mac laptops and a remote work budget, including a monthly internet stipend.
The office is located just a short walk to public transportation and includes snacks, drinks, on-site showers, bike storage.
Budget for professional development, team building, and events.
Monthly book budget.
Weekly virtual fitness bootcamp and weekly virtual yoga with our personal instructors.
Six weeks of fully-paid sabbatical leave for every four years you work here.
Diversity and Inclusion

Job Title: Senior Research And Data Analyst - Remote
Company Name: University of California Office of the President
Job Description:
Location: OaklandFull Time
Job ID: 61261
Job Posting

For UCOP internal applicants, please login to the internal candidate gateway at: Jobs at UCOP

UC OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT

At the University of California (UC), your contributions make a difference. A world leader producing Nobel and Pulitzer prize recipients with over 150 years of groundbreaking research transforming the world. Choose a career where you can leverage your knowledge, skills and aspirations to inspire and support some of the greatest minds in the world, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Working at the University of California is being part of a unique institution, and a vibrant and diverse community. At the University of California, Office of the President, we propel our mission through impactful work locally, in government centers and systemwide. We are passionate people, serving the greater good.

The University of California, one of the largest and most acclaimed institutions of higher learning in the world, is dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and public service. The University of California Office of the President is the headquarters to the 10 campuses, six academic medical centers and three national laboratories and enrolls premier students from California, the nation and the world. Learn more about the UC Office of the President

Department Overview
Graduate, Undergraduate and Equity Affairs at the UC Office of the President provides leadership and support for efforts that advance UC equity and inclusion, close equity gaps, promote access to and successful completion of baccalaureate and graduate degrees, and help to provide an exemplary University experience for all. We are committed to the University of California's academic mission and to our core values: integrity in advocating unapologetically for access and institutional equity, respect for one another, accountability for and effective use of our public resources, and excellence in our service to the University and the State.

Position Summary
Oversees the Information Management & Analytics (IMA) team responsible for supporting university outreach, teacher education programs and diversity and inclusion initiatives with robust data and analysis, informing program, practice, and policy development. The IMA team collects and reports on outcomes for over 300,000 annual program participants across nearly 100 programs. The team also identifies, interprets, examines and highlights longitudinal participant outcomes by matching to external data sources including the UC Data Warehouse (UCDW), the National Student Clearinghouse (NSC), and California's Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CTC). This helps inform annual reports, dashboards, policy development, strategic initiatives, and decision-making. This position can be hybrid or eligible for a remote work arrangement within the state of California. The selected candidate must reside within the state of California or be willing to relocate.

Key Responsibilities

20% Oversees the creation and administration of data collection tools such as surveys and Salesforce instances. Provides campus partners with timely information for program planning. Regularly reviews and leads efforts to update data-collection methodologies for UC outreach and educator preparation and professional development programs.

20% Coordinates research and data projects in IMA according to division, department, and unit priorities. Serves as a liaison with internal and external UC stakeholders to negotiate research and data expectations and requests. As the leader, engages in strategic planning to organize and manage the workflow of the entire unit.

20% Actively integrates information from various data warehouses into organization / office research projects. Serves as a liaison and may negotiate data sharing MOUs with external agencies such as California Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CTC) and the California Department of Education (CDE). Serves as a department liaison with UC data and reporting system development teams, that use, for example, the National Student Clearinghouse, Tableau server, and UC Data Warehouse.

20% Produces and / or presents analyses directed to senior managers outside the immediate unit in order to persuade, influence, or negotiate methods and objectives for complex projects. Provides consultation and support on the completion of reports to UC leadership and external agencies, including reports to the Legislature, California Department of Education, annual UC Accountability Reports, annual UC Regents Budget for Current Operations chapters, and UC Regents Meeting items. Provides leadership for and contributes to the completion of public, self-service data products or dashboards.

15% Supervise and manage 2 full-time Institutional Research Analysts level 3. Provides unit leadership with timely progress updates on projects. Provides mentorship and support for professional development and career advancement of team members.

5% Attends classes, seminars and conferences that enhance professional expertise and foster managerial competency. Participates in activities that enhance the UC community and support the university mission. Upholds the organization's Principles of Community and assures that those values are upheld throughout the department. Other duties as assigned.

Experience
Required Qualifications

At least 5 years of relevant work experience including supervisory experience.

Skills and Abilities
Required Qualifications

Requires expert knowledge in data collection and analysis techniques, along with database administration and programming tools; understanding and experience using statistics or social science research techniques; detailed knowledge of organizational principles and procedures involved in handling sensitive data (for example, Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act, or FERPA).

Advanced active listening, critical thinking, good interpersonal skills, and ability to multi-task.

Advanced ability to present complex findings and recommendations in a clear, concise manner verbally and in writing to a variety of audiences.

Understanding of organizational rules and regulations.

Able to exercise good judgment, decision-making, problem solving.

Able to use data in institutional research.

Experience in working with diverse colleagues, stakeholders and/or clients.

Expert ability to prioritize data gathering, analysis and dissemination according to shifting demands.

Education
Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training.

Preferred Qualifications

Master's or PhD in related area preferred.

About Us:

Curo Pet Care is a family-owned veterinary services company founded in 2015. We are based in San Francisco with operations in California, the Pacific Northwest, and Rocky Mountains. We collaborate with entrepreneurial DVMs, Practice Managers and other leaders in the veterinary industry to build and operate best-in-class small animal hospitals. Our goal is to be the go-to partner for hospital owners, empowering them to provide industry-leading service and care to their clients and patients.

Responsibilities:
The Financial Analyst plays a crucial role in analyzing financial data, conducting financial modeling, and providing strategic financial insights. The analyst will work closely with the the Chief Operating Officer (COO) to support budgeting, forecasting, operational finance, and strategic financial initiatives. They will also contribute to research projects and assist in sourcing veterinary professionals. This position offers the opportunity to gain in-depth knowledge of the veterinary industry, develop business acumen, and enhance strategic finance and financial modeling skills.

Financial Analysis: Analyze financial data, including Profit and Loss statements (P&Ls), to identify trends, patterns, and areas of improvement. Conduct comprehensive financial analyses to support decision-making processes.

Financial Modeling: Develop and maintain complex financial models to support forecasting, budgeting, and scenario analysis. Provide accurate and insightful financial projections.

Research Projects: Assist in conducting research projects related to the veterinary industry, such as market analysis, competitor benchmarking, and industry trends. Collect and analyze data to generate valuable insights.

Doctor Sourcing: Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to identify and attract talented veterinary professionals for the organization. Assist in developing strategies to optimize doctor sourcing efforts.

Budgeting and Forecasting: Assist in the budgeting and forecasting processes, including the preparation of financial reports, variance analysis, and recommendations for budgetary adjustments.

Operational Finance: Support operational financial activities, including cost analysis, expense tracking, and performance metrics. Identify areas of cost optimization and efficiency improvement.

Strategic Financial Initiatives: Contribute to strategic financial projects, such as mergers and acquisitions, investment analysis, and capital allocation. Provide financial insights to support decision-making on strategic initiatives.

Learning and Development: Continuously update knowledge of the veterinary industry, including industry-specific regulations, market dynamics, and emerging trends. Develop expertise in business operations and strategic finance. Enhance financial modeling skills through ongoing training and professional development.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
2-5 years of experience in investment banking, consulting, or a private equity firm, with exposure to financial analysis and modeling.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to work with complex financial data.
Proficiency in financial modeling and advanced Excel skills. Familiarity with financial software and tools is a plus.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication and presentation skills to effectively convey financial insights to stakeholders.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
A proactive mindset with a desire to learn and contribute to the organization's success.
Perks:
This role offers competitive pay and the opportuntity to grow in a fast-paced environment

Job Title: Health Benefits Analyst II-Behavioral Health (Open & Promotional)
Job Description:
NOTE: This recruitment schedule was amended on October 23, 2023 to extend the Final Filing Date. This recruitment has been changed to "Continuous."

San Mateo County Health is seeking experienced individuals for the position of Health Benefits Analyst II-Behavioral Health. Health Benefits Analysts, under general supervision, perform a variety of tasks involved in determining eligibility and enrollment in healthcare financial assistance programs for families and individuals including screening and assisting with the application process for County, State and Federal health insurance programs; determine initial and continuing eligibility for one or more programs in accordance with established procedures; and coordinating and conducting outreach, enrollment, retention and utilization activities; and perform other related duties as assigned.

There are currently two regular vacancies in the Behavioral Health and Recovery Services (BHRS) Division located in San Mateo, but will regularly travel throughout the County to perform outreach events, health insurance enrollments, home visits, meetings, etc.

Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:



Preparation for and conducting of individualized enrollment appointments into Title II (SSDI) and/or Title XVI (SSI) via phone, video chat, or in person; requires frequent travel to various County-run facility sites, community provider sites and home visits.
Conduct individualized one-on-one health insurance screening and enrollment appointments while applying the general rules of motivational interviewing in addressing common communication barriers, including enrollment into Medi-Cal (all programs), Covered California, ACE County, CareAdvantage, commercial Medicare Advantage and/or Prescription Drug Coverage plans; requires frequent travel to various BHRS clinics, community provider sites and home visits.
In-person, phone or video chat assistance with Title II (SSDI) and/or Title XVI (SSI) appeals at the Reconsideration and/or Administrative Law Judge hearing level.
Assist with outreach and enrollment activities performed in coordination with Correctional Health and the Sheriff’s Office at the San Mateo County jails, Maguire Correctional Facility and Maple Street Correctional Center in Redwood City, as well as BHRS' Service Connect location in San Carlos, especially for follow up on pending applications that were initiated at the jails or Service Connect.
Assist with health insurance outreach events, including making copies and inventory of outreach materials, transport equipment and materials weighing up to 10 lbs., set up and breakdown of outreach booth or table, dissemination of information material, and on-site referral to appropriate County agency for enrollment into benefits programs such as CalFresh, CalWorks, General Assistance, Supplemental Security Income, Medicare, for all insurance programs available in San Mateo County with focus on Medi-Cal, Medicare and Covered California.
Monthly data tracking and data analysis of in-house activities related to insurance outreach and enrollments, including review of billing reports provided by BHRS M.I.S. Finance department.

The ideal candidates will have:

Experience working with clients to verify eligibility for and enrollment in Title II (SSDI) and/or Title XVI (SSI).
Two years of experience conducting one-on-one interviews with clients for evaluation of eligibility for available public and private health insurance programs offered through Covered California.
Experience working with a broad range of clients of diverse cultures and backgrounds, and the ability to provide culturally appropriate and proficient services.
Experience using motivational interviewing techniques and addressing common communication barriers.
Working knowledge and experience in the eligibility and enrollment processes for the County's General Assistance program.
Experience conducting home visits, which may have involved working in environments of filthy and odorous conditions.
Experience and ability to transport, lift and move items and supplies up to 10 lbs. for set-up of outreach events.
Demonstrated ability to learn new procedures, processes and stay abreast of complex Federal and State regulations and apply to practices with only limited supervision.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision using initiative and sound independent judgment.
Ability to research and analyze data to identify trends.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work.

NOTE: The eligible list generated from this recruitment may be used to fill future extra-help, term, unclassified, and regular classified vacancies.

Qualifications

Knowledge of:



Public and community resources and programs.
The interrelationships of the various disciplines in the health and human services field.
Interviewing techniques.
County, State and Federal healthcare financial assistance program policies and regulations.
Office procedures and practices, including filing and the operation of standard office equipment.
Basic record keeping principles and practices.
Automated systems.
Workload planning and prioritizing techniques.
Skill/Ability to:

Organize and maintain a heavy workload on a current basis and within set deadlines.
Follow instructions.
Communicate effectively, orally and in writing with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of the work.
Work well under pressure.
Work in accordance with established guidelines.
Make independent decisions.
Assume responsibility for assigned tasks.
Deal effectively with divergent needs of customers.
Interpret and apply laws, rules and regulations.
Prepare, maintain and interpret reports and records.
Education and Experience:
Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to qualify is:

Health Benefits Analyst II: One year of experience performing assessment, placement and/or healthcare financial assistance eligibility work within the last five years.

Application/Examination

Open & Promotional. Anyone may apply. Current County of San Mateo and County of San Mateo Superior Court of California employees with at least six months (1040 hours) of continuous service in a classified regular, probationary, Confidential and Management extra help/limited term, SEIU or AFSCME represented extra-help/term position prior to the final filing date will receive five points added to their final passing score on this examination.

This is a continuous recruitment which may close at any time. The final filing date will be posted 5 days in advance in the County of San Mateo Human Resources Department.

Responses to the supplemental questions must be submitted in addition to our regular employment application form. A resume will not be accepted as a substitute for the required employment application and supplemental questionnaire.

The examination process will consist of an application screening (weight: Pass/Fail) based on the candidates' application and responses to the supplemental questions. Candidates who pass the application screening will be invited to a panel interview (weight: 100%). Depending on the number of applicants, an application appraisal of education and experience may be used in place of other examinations or further evaluation of work experience may be conducted to group applicants by level of qualification. All applicants who meet the minimum qualifications are not guaranteed advancement through any subsequent phase of the examination. All examinations will be given in San Mateo County, California and applicants must participate at their own expense.

IMPORTANT: Applications for this position will only be accepted online. If you are currently on the County's website, you may click the "Apply" button. If you are not on the County's website, please go to https://jobs.smcgov.org/ to apply. Online applications must be received by the Human Resources Department before midnight on the final filing date.

Apply immediately. This recruitment is open on a continuous basis and selections may be made at any time within the process.

~ TENTATIVE RECRUITMENT SCHEDULE ~
Final Filing Date: Continuous
Combined Panel/Department Interview: November 15 and/or 16, 2023

Lawrence Berkeley National Lab’s (LBNL) Nuclear Science Division has an opening for a Program Operations Analyst 3 to join the team.

In this role, you will serve as a point of contact for project support for the Applied Nuclear Physics management team in the Nuclear Science Division. Oversee and coordinate a wide range of business needs under the general supervision of division management, which includes: supporting programs, projects and/or processes from inception to completion, planning and executing tasks, coordinating departmental or Institutional cross-functional teams and activities, performing analyses, and preparing and submitting reports. Act independently to determine methods and procedures on new or special assignments.




What You Will Do:

Support Principal Investigators (PIs) in compiling and editing technical and scientific reports outlining progress on project milestones for distribution to collaborators, managers, and program sponsors as needed.
Responsible for the operational planning and control of large and complex projects/programs.
Provides strategic analysis on finance, budgets, and program operations.
Work with technical staff to identify, manage and track risks. Collaborate broadly across the division to develop mitigation strategies.
Work independently on complex and unique issues where analysis of situations or data requires an advanced and in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Exercise independent judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
May work in a work lead function with administrative staff and collaboratively with key resources to ensure optimal efficiency and effectiveness of administrative processes.
Function independently while ensuring adherence to Division, Laboratory and DOE policies, practices, and procedures.
Set up new systems utilizing technology to enhance communication on all levels of the organization.
Oversee the strategic development and implementation of plans, marketing programs, and partnerships to support the development of collaborative research.
Develop, define, and assist with executing program plans for new and existing research initiatives.
In collaboration with the PIs, develop educational and scientific outreach programs in coordination with LBNL and UCB counterparts.
Coordinate and develop internal and external communications with collaborators, sponsors, and other entities to support ongoing research and new research initiatives.
Work with the Office of National and Homeland Security Program Manager to further strengthen the relationship between ANP and the Homeland Security Program Offices.
Develop content for the programs and aid in the design of effective communication with the scientists for the project web pages and communication for meetings etc.



What is Required:

BA/BS degree in a related field or at least 8 years of related experience.
Wide-ranging, broad experience, using professional concepts and program objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
Demonstrated ability to initiate and maintain harmonious and productive cross-functional and collaborative relationships with peers, supervisors, and stakeholders.
Advanced knowledge and practical skills in MS Office, Google Suite, and database software.
Familiarity with the marketing of products, technology, and services in the scientific field.
Ability to use independent judgment to identify and mitigate potential operational issues and to anticipate and plan for all contingencies.
High level of organizational skills to independently initiate and prioritize responsibilities and handle multiple/competing projects within an environment of changing priorities.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze data/problems and provide practical, resourceful solutions to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
Collaborate and communicate effectively and diplomatically with all levels of management and scientific staff.
May require a technical or scientific background in order to complete the overall operational management responsibility.



Desired Qualifications:

Experience working in a scientific environment in Nuclear Physics, Nuclear Engineering, or related fields.
Working knowledge of LBNL policies, procedures and practices in administrative areas of responsibility such as travel, procurement, personnel, event coordination and document preparation and submission.
Demonstrated experience in processing grant proposals.



Salary:

This position is expected to pay a targeted range of $8,227 to $11,310 per month depending upon the candidate’s skills, knowledge, and abilities, including education, certifications, and years of experience.




Notes:

This is a full-time career appointment, exempt (monthly paid) from overtime pay.
This position may be subject to a background check. Any convictions will be evaluated to determine if they directly relate to the responsibilities and requirements of the position. Having a conviction history will not automatically disqualify an applicant from being considered for employment.
Work will be primarily performed at: Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, 1 Cyclotron Road, Berkeley, CA.

We heartily welcome applications from women, minorities, veterans, and all who would contribute to the Lab's mission of leading scientific discovery, inclusion, and professionalism. In support of our diverse global community, all qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or protected veteran status.

Job Title:
Business Analyst

Job Summary:
Under the leadership of the Purchasing & Ancillary Services (PaAS) Director, the Business Analyst is responsible for owning and supporting procurement program deliverables. Specific areas of focus include: ownership of team assignments & rigorous documentation, diverse data analysis and reporting, defining or capturing new & revised product and business processes; setup & facilitation of meetings, event coordination, stakeholder communication and tasks as assigned in PaAS.

The Business Analyst will leverage their skills and knowledge of process evaluation methodologies, data analysis techniques, using supporting tools & systems. With strong emphasis on system data analysis, process standardization, documentation & training, the Business Analyst will independently own business process assessments, sometimes as a part of team projects, or under guidance by PaAS leadership.

USF seeks a self-motivated, personable, proactive individual for an excellent growth opportunity as Business Analyst in a higher education setting. The Business Analyst role reports to the PaAS e-Procurement Specialist.

Full Job Description:

Essential Job Responsibilities

Supports systems within the PaAS domain through knowledge of solutions, modules and operational procedures

Performs diverse data analysis, trend reporting; diagrams / charts creation for stakeholders

Prepares reports as required by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information

Contribute to operational improvements through business review, elicitation, and evaluating business input/output requirements and formats

Documents current & future processes constructing workflow visualization; studying system capabilities; writing specifications and operational procedures

Maintains training & reference material for users by writing or updating user documentation

Willingness to learn new technologies; independently administer technical solutions with guidance and supervision from e-Procurement Specialist

Prepare PaAS-related business transactions when required

Contributes to team goals by owning, driving & accomplishing collaborative results

Ability to work across teams, build consensus & facilitate business process workshops

Other duties as assigned

Requirements (knowledge, skills, abilities, education and experience)

Self-motivated to own and complete time-sensitive tasks, documentation & business process assessments

Strong critical thinking skills while maintaining objective analysis

An eagerness to learn, map & improve business processes; illustrating in tools such as Visio or Lucidchart

Degree in business, data science, IT or operations desirable; 3-5 years of similar experience considered

At least 2 years of relatable work experience; business or data analysis ownership of 6 months or longer preferred

Demonstrable skills with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) and Google for Higher Education Suite (Google Docs, Gmail, Calendar, Sheets)

Intermediate to advanced skills in planning, analysis & process mapping required

Active listener with strong verbal & written communication skills

Ability to work in team environment & multi-task effectively

Detail-oriented and highly organized

Higher education experience advantageous

Tableau certification, Jaggaer, Banner or ERP systems knowledge desirable

PMI-PBA, IIBA CBAP, CCBA or ISM CPSM certifications a plus

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

About Heroku

As a GTM data analyst, you will deliver key insights and analyses that help Heroku leaders make key decisions that shape strategy, operations, the way we market, sell and interact with customers. You will acquire deep knowledge and understanding of Heroku’s strategy and business goals, build cross-functional relationships, and communicate through digestible, relevant, and actionable storytelling. You will lead data and insights, partnering with marketers, sales strategists, data engineers, visualization engineers, and other colleagues to deliver data products, such as dashboards, reports and actionable insights. You will use business thinking, collaboration, and analytical practices to wrangle data and deliver relevant insights.



Success in the Role

As a data analyst on the team, you are:

A hands-on analyst
You will generate insights (e.g., product analytics, retention analysis, behavioral personas and much more) to accelerate business growth. This requires acquiring and cleaning data from multiple sources, structuring and building data models, analyzing to generate insights, and distr ibuting those insights to business leaders.
You are passionate about understanding the business problem and your internal users, focusing on outcome not output, and iterating to achieve the business outcome.
A strategic problem solver
You understand the “big picture” context of your business and analyze data with business a mentality.
You understand how to measure which business strategies are effective and which are not.
You translate business challenges into an analytical plan; you think practically and creatively to craft quick, effective solutions to problems.
A relationship builder
You will develop relationships and collaborate with teams to understand business problems and build and implement an analytical plan.
You are comfortable delivering insights to an executive audience.
You partner with stakeholders to establish success metrics.
A cross-functional partner
You will partner with data engineers and marketing/sales to instrument, acquire, develop, and structure data assets that are critical to measuring the success of our business.
Identify internal and external collaborators to curate data assets and produce actionable data insights and products.
Your Experiences
4-6 years of experience in data, marketing, or business analytics
You are proficient in SQL and have experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or similar
You have experience with marketing data (such as Google Analytics, Pardot, CRM Analytics, Twillio) and have experience collaborating with marketing ops and/or revenue ops teams
You are proficient in telling data stories in a wide range of formats, including slides, charts, and dashboards (e.g. Tableau), and can coherently articulate the business impact of your insights product

Preferred Experience

A Master’s degree or equivalent experience in data science, statistics, applied mathematics, analytics or a related field

As a Business Systems Analyst (BSA), you will be responsible for providing systems analysis support for technology-enabled solutions serving internal business units and work closely with business leaders and users, subject matter experts, project managers and IT professionals. You will elicit requirements and provide clear, concise documentation, analyze systems, analyze data, troubleshoot and provide root cause analysis, and contribute to systems-related business process design and improvement.

PLEASE NOTE: hiring preference will be given to candidates residing in the San Francisco Bay Area or California.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Collaborate actively with business partners, project managers, all levels of management, technical staff, architects, and vendors to analyze Business Requirements/Needs and create clear and concise functional requirements
Actively lead and participate in requirements elicitation and apply a combination of business and technical knowledge to solve business problems with cost-effective technical solutions
Use creative problem-solving skills to remove barriers and effective communication skills to keep all parties informed of status
Work with end-users as needed to develop and execute test plans to verify business systems and processes work as expected
Develop and recommend operational processes and /or process improvements
Support production system incidents; troubleshoot and provide root cause analysis

WHAT YOU WILL BRING

A degree from a four-year college (e. g., BS) or equivalent work experience
3 or more years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Systems Analyst, Technical Analyst or comparable position in a healthcare environment
Prior experience at a healthcare organization, particularly at a managed health plan
1-3 years’ experience with relational databases and writing SQL queries
Familiarity in managing requirements (Azure DevOps preferred)
Familiarity with HIPAA healthcare EDI transactions and file formats preferred
Excellent understanding of all phases of SDLC, with Agile experience a strong plus
Strong understanding and experience gathering requirements and documentation
Lead productive meetings, deliver professional oral and written presentations
Ability to interact well with co-workers and outside contacts. Ability to work in a team environment using industry best practices

WHAT WE OFFER

A competitive and robust compensation package, including:

Health benefits – several plan choices to cover you and your dependents medical, dental, vision needs
Retirement – Employer-matched CalPERS Pension and 401(a) plans, 457 Plan
Time off – 23 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) and 13 paid holidays

At Acumen, LLC / The SPHERE Institute, Data and Policy Analysts provide analytical support for research and consulting projects for government and private clients, primarily in the area of health policy. This position is responsible for managing and analyzing data, researching and interpreting policy, and communicating findings to multiple audiences.

Data and Policy Analysts perform a wide array of functions as part of the research process. Those applicants interested in focusing on writing/coordinating will help create and report descriptive statistics, conduct literature searches, independent research and summarize findings, coordinate project activities and communications among diverse groups of internal and external clients and team members, interpret study specifications, research findings and quantitative analyses for relevant audiences, prepare project reports, memos, presentations and proposals, deliver technical assistance and presenting findings to clients, and perform other duties as assigned.

As we review your materials, we are looking for candidates who best exemplify the following qualifications:
Qualifications Required
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative, public policy, or related field or equivalent relevant experience
Prior work experience is not necessary
Good quantitative analytical skills
Good oral and written communication skills
Good organizational skills and strong attention to detail
Familiar with one or more of the following technical competencies: statistics programming, policy writing, research methods documentation, or project management
Able to demonstrate initiative, critical thinking, and problem-solving
Able to work in a team-oriented environment
Able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Demonstrated aptitude and enthusiasm for learning
Qualifications Desired
Demonstrates an interest in health and social policy
Any application without a cover letter will not be considered. Transcripts and writing samples are not required, however highly preferred and may be requested. We are excited to review your application and look forward to seeing how you may best contribute to our work.

The salary range for this position is $50,000- $110,000.
Please note, this position is available in our Burlingame, CA office. Project teams are comprised of employees who work across all of our offices. Please apply to the office location you would most prefer to work from. Applying to multiple offices for the same role will not increase your likelihood of moving forward in the hiring process.
Please upload all documents requested in the application. We are excited to review your application and look forward to seeing how you can contribute to our mission!

Job Title: Research Data Analyst - Division of HIV, Infectious Diseases and Global Medicine
Job Description:
The statistician/data analyst position will: (1) create and develop the clinical and specimen databases and shipping inventories, (2) analyze data for several ongoing studies related to HIV-associated lung diseases, (3) assist with preparing the data for presentation/publication, and (4) cross-check and proofread all results, tables, and figures prior to publication. The individual will also generate regular reports on the state of each study’s data, coordinate regular data cleaning and updating activities with team members of the various projects. As all of the studies are locally and internationally based, the individual will regularly interact with an international team of project collaborators. The individual will work independently, but also as a member of the larger team, and will work under the direct supervision of the PI.

The incumbent will also generate regular reports on the state of each study’s data, coordinate regular data cleaning and updating activities with team members of the various projects, and assist with maintaining IRB approval. As all of the studies are locally and internationally based, the incumbent will regularly interact with an international team of project collaborators.


To see the salary range for this position (we recommend that you make a note of the job code and use that to look up): TCS Non-Academic Titles Search (ucop.edu)


Please note: The compensation ranges listed online for roles not covered by a bargaining unit agreement are very wide, however a job offer will typically fall in the range of 80% - 120% of the established mid-point. An offer will take into consideration the experience of the final candidate AND the current salary level of individuals working at UCSF in a similar role.


For roles covered by a bargaining unit agreement, there will be specific rules about where a new hire would be placed on the range.


To learn more about the benefits of working at UCSF, including total compensation, please visit: https://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/compensation-and-benefits/index.html

Department Description

The Division of HIV, Infectious Diseases and Global Medicine at the University of California San Francisco (UCSF) is an internationally recognized global leader in clinical care, research, and education. With its home-base located at Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital and Trauma Center (ZSFG), the Division has been ranked as the top facility in the country for AIDS care since 1983. The Division’s work is featured frequently in the media, and it is often visited by numerous international, national, state, and local dignitaries and delegations. The Division consists of approximately 36 faculty members, 11 fellows/postdoctoral scholars and 170 academic and staff employees. It is the largest Division of the Department of Medicine (DOM) at ZSFG, with a total expenditure budget of approximately $52 million dollars.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or higher with a major in statistics or a related field and / or equivalent experience / training
One-plus (1+) years of related data analysis experience
Knowledge of at least one statistical program such as STATA, SAS, or R is required. Experience with database programs such as MS Excel, MS Access, or SQL is required to ensure the accuracy of study data, produce several databases for clinical and specimen management, produce relevant datasets for analysis, conduct data analysis, and prepare data for publication/presentation
Knowledge of statistical principles is needed to perform the appropriate statistical analysis
Skills to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner both verbally and written

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s degree in statistics, epidemiology, public health or a related field
Knowledge of medical terminology with a focus on HIV-associated pneumonias and microbiome profiling is needed to work with the many study collaborators
Experience working in HIV/AIDS and/or pulmonary research
Experience working on international collaborations
Experience programming in R

About UCSF

The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.

Pride Values

UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu

Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.

Hazen and Sawyer has an exceptional opportunity for a self-motivated and dynamic individual to join our growing Utility Management Solutions Group. This opportunity involves working with multi-disciplinary teams of engineers, planners, and scientists to develop utility management solutions for a wide array of water-related projects locally, and nationwide. The position is within the West Region Asset Management group and involves collaboration with Digital Strategies and Solutions as well as GIS teams. This collaboration would leverage Hazen’s advanced planning services and data analytics to ensure delivery of exceptional solutions to our clients. Moreover, the successful candidate will have the chance to utilize many of the analytical skills used in asset and utility management projects to aid engineering staff on other planning and design projects.

The job duties for this position include:

Develop, implement, and maintain advanced analytics models and solutions to support decision making in all areas of utility and asset management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams of Subject Matter Experts to understand client business needs and identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, and other business outcomes.
Apply industry best practices and analytical approaches to identify opportunities in improving processes, increasing efficiency, and reducing costs.
Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, development of data protocols, processing, analysis, reports, data visualization and presentations.
Coordinate and assist in conducting field condition assessments.
Participate in strategic business development planning and execution.
Participate in proposal development.
Interface with clients as required.
Develop, maintain, and grow asset management expertise.
Increase awareness of Hazen’s asset management capabilities both externally (participation in industry organizations, conferences, and seminars) and internally within Hazen.
Extend the application of asset management practices and tools to a broader range of engineering and planning related projects.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Environmental Science, GIS, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or closely related fields.
Master’s degree is a plus.
Minimum 3 years of relevant work experience.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Proficiency in database development, data analytics, and data models.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI or similar tools
Experience with spatial analytical tools such as ESRI ArcGIS and related products.
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work with a team or independently.
Ability to travel regionally.

Preferred Skills:

Experience in utility management or asset management.
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and data mining techniques.
Project or Task management experience.
Public speaking experience.
Familiarity with scripting languages (Python, R), Business Intelligence and database development skills using SQL, Visual Basics, Python, or related programming languages
Proficient in Esri’s ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online, Story Maps and ArcMap
Working familiarity with critical elements of the Microsoft BI stack (e.g., Power Query, Power BI)
Revit 3D Modeling experience
Previous experience in water and wastewater planning or environmental science.
Familiarity with comparative economics evaluations.

Benefits: 401k employer contribution, performance bonus, comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance, employee assistance and wellness programs.

Job Title: Sr. Research Technology Business Process Analyst
Job Description:
1.0 FTE Full time Day - 08 Hour R2332960 Hybrid 84869 TDS RESEARCH TECH APP SOLNS Technology & Digital Solutions 455 Broadway,REDWOOD CITY,California

If you're ready to be part of our legacy of hope and innovation, we encourage you to take the first step and explore our current job openings. Your best is waiting to be discovered.




Day - 08 Hour (United States of America)

Sr. Research Technology Business Process Analyst is an integral part of the Research Technology Application Solutions team within Technology and Digital Solutions (TDS). This vibrant and innovative team provides research technology solutions and services for all of Stanford Medicine (School of Medicine, Stanford Health Care, and Stanford Children's Health).

This position will be responsible for analyzing and improving our Research Technology organization’s business processes, including transforming the intake process and facilitating cross-functional, complex research technology project requests, as well as maintaining a knowledge base of research technology issues and solutions. This position requires excellent analytical skills, a deep understanding of research technologies, and the ability to communicate complex information quickly and effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Additional responsibilities include:

Develop and maintain process maps and related documentation
Monitor and evaluate process performance metrics to identify areas for further improvement
Facilitate the intake process for research technology requests, including initial triage, documentation, and prioritization
Identify areas for process improvement and recommend enhancements
Provide support to Research Technology teams in troubleshooting process issues and identifying root causes
Facilitate creation of statements of work with Research Technology team members and customers, formalizing the functional and financial details of engagements.

We are looking for an exceptional candidate who is friendly, enthusiastic about research, collaborative, possesses excellent communication skills, is detail-oriented, and has a proven track record of providing superior customer support.

The Stanford Medicine TDS group was formed to provide the Stanford Medicine community with the most innovative technology services as efficiently as possible. Led by Michael Pfeffer, CIO and Michael Halaas, Chief Operating Officer and Associate Dean in the School of Medicine, the unified organization enables new opportunities for groundbreaking work and compassionate care.

This is a Stanford Health Care job.

A Brief Overview
The Business Senior Systems Analyst I supports core functions of the hospital's business & financial applications to enable cost-effective, high quality, efficient, and safe patient care. This position will implement, administer, and support assigned systems under the minimal guidance of senior members of the team. The position will have a thorough understanding of managing business and financial operations within a healthcare environment. This position independently addresses issues and design decisions of moderate to high complexity with little or no supervision and delivers clear communication and documentation of complex concepts and issues related to applications, interfaces, data structures, and workflows across the organization.

Locations
Stanford Health Care

What you will do

Provide tier-2 support of application incidents reported through the help desk; including 24/7 on call coverage as required
Provide analytical assistance to junior team members to resolve application incidents, maintenance items, and enhancement requests
Coordinate application support with other information technology teams including Infrastructure, Integration, Reporting, and the help desk
Implement changes using documented procedures that are compliant with department’s policies and procedures
Work with and mentor junior staff members to document workflows
Act as a technology subject matter expert and clearly communicate technical concepts in business terms between and across the different groups while influencing outcomes
Perform a major role in complex software upgrade initiatives
Lead small to medium complexity new software installations and enhancement requests
Maintain up-to-date project documents for all initiatives that include technical details, user expectations, project goals, work effort, accountability, and deliverables
Continually identity opportunities for functional and stability improvement in applications
Identify system optimization and enhancements and collaborate with vendors and other ITS analysts in order to design and implement effective solutions
Anticipate and resolve system problems
Research issues and use independent analysis and judgment to produce solution options (including alternative solutions when necessary to address system limitations) to complex and/or controversial matters, including pros, cons, risks, benefits, costs, and unintended consequences
Participate in and frequently facilitate/organize team and cross-team meetings and maintain appropriate meeting records


Education Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in related field: Computer Science, Information Systems or a directly related field of engineering required
Certification in relevant applications Preferred


Experience Qualifications

Five or more years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience
Required and
Prefer experience with 2 major implementations or upgrades Preferred


Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Mid-level Microsoft Office skills
Excellent written, oral, instructional, presentation and interpersonal skills focused on motivation and positive attitude. Highly self-motivated, directed and change oriented. Very strong customer orientation
Ability to analyze highly complex systems and workflows
Ability to conceptualize, plan, organize, coordinate, and manage the work of a major program or function within the department
Ability to engage actively in complex discussions, often on challenging and/or controversial subjects
Ability to negotiate on behalf of others to achieve best outcomes for the department and the organization as a whole
Ability to handle confrontation with appropriate grace, professionalism, cordiality, and firmness, and manages/resolves disputes appropriately
Ability to communicate concepts in elegant, concise, eloquent form to management and to cross-functional departments or teams verbally, in writing, and through pictures or diagrams when appropriate
Ability to establish a set of tasks and activities associated with an intended outcome and timeline
Ability to take action consistent with available facts, constraints, and anticipated consequences
Ability to use appropriate interpersonal skills to give information to and receive information from coworkers and clients in a tactfully and professional manner
Ability to use effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions and/or reaching conclusions
Ability to develop new skills and teach others
Ability to collaborate and build consensus with stakeholders
Ability to understand and adhere to operational standards, policies, and procedures
Ability to identify risks and issues
Ability to develop solutions for new and unfamiliar challenges
Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and interpret results
Knowledge of current issues and trends in health care and clinical operations in a health care system
Healthcare knowledge base that promotes a high level of credibility with organization end users and executives
Knowledge of core business and financial applications as well as other information systems and computer applications used in a health care setting
Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)

About Rippling

Rippling gives businesses one place to run HR, IT, and Finance. It brings together all of the workforce systems that are normally scattered across a company, like payroll, expenses, benefits, and computers. For the first time ever, you can manage and automate every part of the employee lifecycle in a single system.

Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can hire a new employee anywhere in the world and set up their payroll, corporate card, computer, benefits, and even third-party apps like Slack and Microsoft 365—all within 90 seconds.

Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $1.2B from the world’s top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, Greenoaks, and Bedrock—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes.

About the role

Rippling is looking to hire a Data Analyst to join our growing customer revenue strategy and operations team. They will be immediately and directly responsible for overseeing the buildout of Rippling’s customer data model. You will develop data visualizations and uncover insights that support the growth of our customer focused sales teams. You’ll work closely with colleagues to provide visibility into the performance of the business, identify key trends, and meet our analytics needs as the organization grows. You’ll also collaborate closely with sales leadership and other key cross-functional partners to define and track KPIs, as well as develop and execute operational plans across our analytics efforts.

The ideal candidate will have worked in fast-paced environments before, ideally at a multi-product SaaS company and will have made a measurable impact to the sales organization. You should also be comfortable tackling ambiguous and challenging problems and working independently as well as part of a team. This is an opportunity to work on high-visibility strategic initiatives in a rapidly growing sales organization.

What you will do
Understand the Business and Deploy Metrics : Partner with the revenue operations and business operations teams to develop a deep understanding of the business. Engage with Account Management, Customer Experience and Product AE Sales teams to understand how teams capture and utilize customer data. Leverage your understanding to define, document, develop and deploy actionable metrics to help guide decision-making at Rippling.
DRI for Development of Customer Data Tables: Collaborate with data science and engineering to build, document, and manage core customer data tables for Rippling.
Data & Reporting: Build and own critical reporting and self-serve dashboards that provide insights into Rippling’s business performance.
Project Management: Individually own and drive analyses, workstreams, and high priority projects.
Data Driven Insights: Proactively provide insights on customer sales performance and customer business processes.
What you will need
4+ years working with data, partnering with various orgs (Account Management, Customer Experience, Marketing, Sales, Data Analytics, Data Engineering)
Proficiency in data visualization, adept at tailoring presentations to executives, managers, and individual contributors within the organization.
Expertise with visualization tools like Tableau, Mode and Looker (we use Mode and Tableau)
Experience in developing definitional documentation, as well as leading educational sessions for business teams on dashboards and analytical insights.
Ability to write complex SQL and establish ad-hoc data pipelines, ideally within Snowflake. Bonus but not needed: experience with Python/R.
Experience designing and/or maintaining ETLs to ensure accuracy and consistency of data from multiple sources
Prior experience working in a startup or a hyper growth technology company
Additional Information

Rippling is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected characteristics, Rippling is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities who need assistance during the hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please email accomodations@rippling.com

Rippling highly values having employees working in-office to foster a collaborative work environment and company culture. For office-based employees (employees who live within a 40 mile radius of a Rippling office), Rippling considers working in the office, at least three days a week under current policy, to be an essential function of the employee's role.

This role will receive a competitive salary + benefits + equity. The salary for US-based employees will be aligned with one of the ranges below based on location.

Job Title: Staff Data Analyst Operations, Infrastructure & Systems
Job Description:
What to Expect
The Business Analytics team is responsible for providing data and insights on our business performance and associated processes. The team supports business leaders, in the field and at headquarter, to guide decision making.

The team is looking to hire a Staff Data Analyst focused on building the reporting necessary to measure headcount and infrastructure & locations related metrics for the global sales and service organization.You will work closely with the application, data engineering and operations teams to understand the data processing flow, and ensure analytics needs are met to accurately report on headcount and infrastructure related data. Developing intuitive and reliable dashboards using tools such as Tableau will be crucial to the Analyst’s success. He/she must be able to understand the various operation processes and identify the most important steps and define associated metrics. You will be tasked with providing regular report to our executive team. To be successful in this role, you will need to be experienced in analytics, be effective working on a project basis and be a strong communicator.
What You’ll Do
Work with business and systems stakeholders to define systems requirements to support data generation and data flow for headcount, infrastructure, and system reporting
Develop a strong understanding of the data flow between our systems to maintain consistent and up to date reporting
Develop metrics, tools, and dashboards to measure business processes efficiency related to staffing/infrastructure reporting and build ad hoc reports/analyses based on requests from the business teams
Support recurring reports for the global sales and service operations teams and the executive team
Act as a database and system expert; provide support to the users from the Sales and Service organization on related applications, operations processes, and operational reports
Analyze current business processes and applications, and suggest best practices, and opportunities for improvement through automation or simplification
Build productive relationships and communicate effectively with Data Engineering, Product, Finance and other cross functional teams to identify and address areas for improvement
What You’ll Bring
Minimum of Bachelor's Degree in related field (analytics, computer science, business) or equivalent
Strong experience with SQL, Tableau and/or any other visualization tools Experience with Python or other programming language
Strong knowledge of Database Management concepts
6+ years of experience in Analytics
Able to work independently and in a team, rigorous, detail-oriented, critical thinker and performance-driven
Can do attitude and self-driven individual
Strong written and verbal communication skills

Fluent in business team communication

Experience in higher education domain a major plus

Interview business team, document as-is and to-be process.

Work with internal ITS folks to come up with the recommendation

Present to the leadership team on the recommendations.

At least 5 to 6 years of experience as a Business Analyst.

The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for projects involving research, analysis, and the presentation of findings, insights, and recommendations based on various factors (ex: data insights, regulatory changes, feedback from QA reviews, market information, etc.) to solve business problems and improve outcomes.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Evaluate, communicate and lead business requests for implementation prioritization
Perform research by gathering data from a variety of healthcare sources, including internal and external data/research
Present analytical findings and insights to stakeholders and leadership using effective storyboarding and dynamic visuals
Diligently pursue learning and training opportunities to build skills and knowledge
Ability to translate project goals and requirements to business and technical teams with a confirmed understanding of development processes
Coordinate and complete ad hoc requests for data and analysis, utilizing business, operational, and analytical skills/knowledge
Owns report development for reports/dashboards
Performs other job duties as required by manager/supervisor.


QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in addition to 3+ years of relevant experience to include business analysis work
3+ years analytical experience working in healthcare data quality reporting
Expert in SQL and other common analytic/data tools (3+ years)
Development and Building experience with Business Intelligence tools like SQL Server Reporting Server, PowerBI or other similar tools (3+ years)
Experience with standard healthcare Quality Measures and reporting, like NCQA HEDIS, CMS eCQM, PQA, P4P, and more
Understanding of the sources and contents of health care data with experience in reporting and/or analytic workflows for health care organizations
Displays strong communication abilities to effectively coordinate work and collaborate with clinical, operations and IT teams
Motivation to build best in class software
Able to work independently and follow through on work commitments
Able to research and apply problem solving, analytical skills


LANGUAGE:

Must be able to fluently speak, read and write English.
Fluent in Chinese (Cantonese and/or Mandarin), Vietnamese, Spanish and other languages may be required depending on location.
Fluency in other languages are an asset.


STATUS:

This is an FLSA Exempt position.
This is not an OSHA low-risk position.
